metadata.title: CVE-2022-2393 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in pki-core, which could allow a user to get a certificatefor another user identity when directory-based authentication is enabled.This flaw allows an authenticated attacker on the adjacent network toimpersonate another user within the scope of the domain, but they would notbe able to decrypt message content.

criterions.comment: dogtag-pki package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
